script.message: The Neuropil menu accessible from the Header Bar lists all neuropils.
This menu can be used to control the neuropils displayed in the visualization panel.
First we hide all neuropils
Next we toggle a few neuropils
Finally we show all neuropils
Done! Try it yourself!
The Neurons/Synapses menu accessible from the Header Bar lists all neurons and synapses visualized in the visualization panel.
It is useful to highlight, hide, pin neurons of interest when the view in the visualization panel becomes cluttered.
First we visualize some neurons.

script.query: show PN in right antennal lobe

script.message: Now we open the Neurons/Synapses Menu and click on one of the neurons
This has the same effect of clicking on the neuron in the 3D visualization.
and brings up the info panel for this neuron.
We can hide the neuron
reveal the neuron
pin the neuron
unpin the neuron
and delete the neuron
Done! Try it yourself!

neuron_menu.description: Access the list of neurons and synapses in the visualization panel to highlight, retrieve info of, pin, hide and delete individual neurons.

script.message: You can use your mouse to navigate through neurons in the visualization panel.
Let's first bring up neurons in the MB!

script.query: Show neurons in the right MB

script.message: To highlight a neuron, move mouse cursor onto the displayed neuron.
Let's try another neuron.
To obtain the detailed info about this neuron, single click on the neuron.
Info Panel on the left will display basic info of the neuron, and the synaptic partners of the neuron. Check out the 'Info Panel' demo for more information on how to use the Info Panel
Double-clicking a neuron pins the neuron.
Double-clicking it again to unpin.
Done! Try it yourself!

pin_select_highlight.description: Mouse operations in the visualization panel to highlight, retrieve info of, pin and delete individual neurons.

script.message: Here we show the function of the buttons on the top right.
Clicking on the button, the GUI Usage Info will pop out.
Now let's make a simple query

script.query: show olfactory sensory neurons in right al
add LNs in the right al

script.message: We can use the button zoom into the neurons visualized.
Let's take a screenshot of the visualization using the button .
We can reset the view to the original by clicking on button.
Now we will pin some of the neurons
We can hide everything but the pinned neurons using the button
and reveal everything in the visualization panel using the button
We can remove all neurons except the pinned neurons by the button
To remove pinned neurons but keep unpinned neurons, you will need to use the Neurons/Synapses Menu.
Done! Try it yourself!

gui_buttons.description: Function of the GUI button on the top right.

script.message: Let's explore some connectivity in the antennal lobe
Let's add some Olfactory Sensory Neurons to the scene

script.query: show OSN in the right AL

script.message: We then add some uniglomerular projection neurons

script.query: add uPN in the right AL
add picky LN in right AL
add broad LN in right AL

script.message: Now let's open Graph View to see the neuronal graph with the button.
Now let's download the connectivity between these neurons by using the button
Done! Try it yourself!

connectivity_1.description: Explore the connectivity of visualized neurons with buttons

script.message: The settings menu can be accessed by clicking on icon on the top right
Browse through the setting to see what settings can be customized.
Done! Try it yourself!

visualization_settings.description: Open Visualization Settings to change background color, neuropil color, how neurons are rendered, etc.

script.message: A reference of supported English queries can be found by clicking on the button left to the search bar.
Done! Try it yourself!
Info Panel provides all information available of a neuron.
Simply click on the neuron in the visualization panel or from the Neurons/Synapses menu to bring up its information.
You can bring up one of pre- and post-synaptic partner by clicking on the + button in the list of partners.
You can bring up all of its pre- and post-synaptic partner according to the filtered value.
Done! Try it yourself!

infopanel.description: Bring up Info Panel for the neuron to access detail information about neurons and their synaptic partners.

script.message: Hi there!
Let's query for local neurons in the left antennal lobe that express glutamate neurotransmitter!

script.query: show glutamatergic local neurons in the left antennal lobe

script.message: 'Show' always clears the visualization panel before visualizing the neurons in the query!
Let's try using 'Show' again.

script.query: Show Mushroom Body Output Neurons in the right MB

script.message: Done. Compare this to the 'Add' demo!
Try it yourself!

show_1.description: Clear the work space and visualize neurons according to a specific query.

script.message: Hi!
Let's query for local neurons in the left antennal lobe that express glutamate neurotransmitter!

script.query: show glutamatergic local neurons in the left antennal lobe

script.message: 'Add' visualizes the neurons in the query on top of what's in the visualization panel!
Let's try using adding some neurons.

script.query: Add Mushroom Body Output Neurons in the right MB

script.message: Done
It is all yours now! Try it yourself!

add_1.description: In addition to what is currently displayed, visualize the neurons according to a specific query

script.message: Hi!
Let's query for dopaminergic neurons in the Mushroom Body!
Now let's add Kenyon Cells.
Now let's undo what we just did.
Now let's add Mushroom Body Output Neurons.
Done
It is all yours now! Try it yourself!

undo_1.description: Go back to a previous step (UNDO).

script.message: Hi!
Let's query for neurons from the Antennal Lobe!
Now let's only keep those expressing glutamate that innervate the left AL and remove the rest.

script.query: Keep glutamatergic neurons in left AL

script.message: Done
It is all yours now! Try it yourself!

keep_1.description: Filter neurons in the current visualization panel based on a specific query.

script.message: Hi!
Let's query for local neurons from the right antennal lobe!
Now let's only remove the glutamatergic neurons in the right AL.

script.query: Remove glutamatergic neurons from the right al

script.message: Done
It is all yours now! Try it yourself!

remove_1.description: Remove neurons from the current visualization panel based on a specific query.

script.message: Hi!
Let's query for neurons innervating the right antennal lobe!
Now let's pin the local neurons.

script.query: Pin LNs in the right AL

script.message: Now let's unpin glutamatergic neurons.
Done
It is all yours now! Try it yourself!

pinunpin_1.description: Pin (Persistently highlight) or Unpin neurons in the current visualization panel based on a specific query.

script.message: Hi!
Let's query for dopaminergic  neurons in the right MB.

script.query: Show dopaminergic neurons in the right MB

script.message: Let's add Mushroom Body Output Neuron in the left MB.

script.query: add MBON in the left MB

script.message: Now let's hide the dopaminergic neurons.
Now let's reveal all the DANs that is in the visualization panel.
Done
It is all yours now! Try it yourself!

hide_1.description: Hide or reveal neurons in the current visualization panel based on a specific query.

script.message: Hi!
Let's query for local neurons from the right antennal lobe!
Now let's color them red.
If only a color is specified, the last queried neurons will be colored.
Neurons to be colored can also be specified. For example, we can color GABAergic neurons blue, using the hex code for blue.
Done
It is all yours now! Try it yourself!

color_1.description: Color neurons in the current visualization panelvisualization panel based on a specific query

script.message: Hi!
Let's query for local neurons from the right antennal lobe!

script.query: Show local neurons in right al

script.message: Now we clear the visualization panel.
Done
It is all yours now! Try it yourself!
Hi there!
A quick way to find neurons whose name contains a string is to use the $$ syntax.
The following query searches for all neurons whose name contains the string 'MBON'.
Regular expression can be used with the syntax /rRE/r, where RE should be replaced by the regex string. The following query is the equivalent to the previous one:
Since MBON is a commonly known neuron type, one can also search for MBONs with the following query
Try it yourself!

basic_query1.description: Query with string match, Regular Expression, and commonly known names of neuron types
basic_query1.category: Basic English Queries (Specifying what you want to search for)

script.message: Hi there!
Let's load multiple neurons using their Larva L1EM Skeleton IDs.
Try it yourself!

basic_query2.description: Load a list of neurons using their Larva L1EM Skeleton IDs using: show /:referenceId:[bodyId1, bodyId2, ...]
basic_query2.category: Basic English Queries (Specifying what you want to search for)

script.message: Hi there!
Let's show all neurons that have arborizations in right Antennal Lobe.
Try it yourself!

basic_query3.description: Querying neurons based on arborization patterns.
basic_query3.category: Basic English Queries (Specifying what you want to search for)

script.message: Hi there!
Let's display an OSN and its synaptic partners.
To add Projection Neurons postsyaptic to the neurons in the current workspace, and has at least 10 synapses from any one of these neurons, we use the following query.

script.query: add postsynaptic PN with at least 10 synapses

script.message: Try it yourself!

basic_query4.category: Basic English Queries (Specifying what you want to search for)
